title: Design System Aware Vibe Coding
description: Best practices for vibe coders who want greater control over UI components built in Figma and connecting design system workflows with AI-assisted coding for production-grade micro-SaaS.

title: AI for Product Builders
description: Understand the AI revolution from a product perspective. Learn how large language models work and how to evaluate AI tools for your workflow and how to build products that leverage AI capabilities.

title: Foundations of American Democracy
description: Explore the principles and institutions and processes that form the foundation of American democracy. From the Constitution to civic engagement learn how government works and how you can participate.

title: Visual Design Fundamentals
description: Master the core principles of visual design including typography and color theory and layout and composition. Build a strong foundation for creating aesthetically pleasing and effective designs.

title: Tech Entrepreneurship 101
description: As we step into the AI era opportunities arise for individuals to build a digital business from scratch. Here is a four week syllabus and action plan to kick start your entrepreneurship journey.

title: Playful Frontend
description: Learn HTML and CSS and JavaScript and survey popular frontend frameworks to create visually and interactively dynamic websites. Start with basics on how to approach programming learning in the age of AI.

title: Education in the AI Era
description: Given that LLMs and various AI tools can give us answers in a matter of seconds, what study techniques could students and learners apply to learn, absorb knowledge, and master skills? What are the latest strategies and tools are educational institutions deploying to assess learning outcomes? This is an introduction syllabus that every Syllabind learner, creator, and platform builder should start with in order to shape the education experience moving forward.

title: Philosophy and History of Education
description: Explore the true meaning and purpose of education through the lens of history and philosophy. From Plato's Academy to MOOCs, examine how education shapes minds, relates to democratic society, and whether technology has truly democratized learning.
